content:
There are numerous places to stay and things to do in India when it comes to exploring Buddhist art and architecture. Here are some recommendations:

1. Bodhgaya: This is the place where the Buddha is said to have attained enlightenment. You can find a multitude of temples and monasteries in the town. The Mahabodhi Temple is the main attraction and has a large statue of the Buddha, as well as other significant relics.

2. Sarnath: This is where the Buddha delivered his first sermon after attaining enlightenment. You can visit the Dhamek Stupa and the ruins of monasteries and temples dating back to the 3rd century BCE.

3. Kushinagar: This is the place where the Buddha passed away, also known as his Mahaparinirvana. There are numerous sites to visit, such as the Mahaparinirvana Temple and the Mathakaut Temple.

4. Dhauli: Dhauli is a hill located close to Bhubaneswar in Odisha and considered the place where Emperor Ashoka converted to Buddhism. Here you will find major monuments such as a peace pagoda, rock-cut edicts, and an elephant sculpture.

5. Leh-Ladakh: In northern India, you could visit the Le-Ladakh region, where you will find numerous Tibetan-style monasteries (gompas), with stunning murals and frescoes in the backdrop of the Himalayas.

As for recommendations on where to stay, it would depend on your preferences and itinerary. There are many guesthouses and hotels near these sites, depending on your budget.

I hope these tips help you plan your trip to India to see the impressive Buddhist art and architecture.
